Sentencas: We report on the consequences of operating Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell (SOEC) under an extreme electrical polarization or with a low supply of feedstock chemicals.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: Under such conditions, subsequent switching from dominantly ionic conductivity to mixed conductivity is lowering the cells' Faradic efficiency.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: We propose a theoretical model, able to accurately predict polarization curve, Faradic efficiency and synthetic fuel production for Zirconia electrolyte-based (8YSZ) cells.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: To the best of our knowledge this is the first model of SOEC constructed without the assumption of pure ionic conductivity in YSZ.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: Experimental results from literature were used to extrapolate, fit and validated 8YSZ properties for oxygen partial pressure below 10(-20) atm.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: We report a simple fuel map, suggesting design conditions for SOEC, securing the operation with near 100% Faradic efficiency.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: This consideration suggests strong evidence against a common practice of using Faraday's law to estimate electrolysis yield.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals

Sentencas: Moreover, we speculate that surge of potential difference at high current densities may be due to a switch to the mixed conduction mode, rather than only the concentration loss.
Titulo: Theoretical consideration of Solid Oxide Electrolyzer Cell with zirconia-based electrolyte operated under extreme polarization or with low supply of feedstock chemicals
